Check whether Input is Valid

Source: R/check-correctness-input.R
check_correctness_input.Rd

Checks whether the input for the function CVN is valid. This function does not return anything. The execution of the function halts when an issue has been detected.

Usage

check_correctness_input(raw_data, W, lambda1, lambda2, gamma1, gamma2, rho)

Arguments

raw_data

A list with matrices. The number of columns should be the same for each matrix

W

The \((m \times m)\)-dimensional upper-triangular weight matrix \(W\)

lambda1

A vector of \(\lambda_1\)'s LASSO penalty terms

lambda2

A vector of \(\lambda_2\)'s global smoothing parameters

gamma1

A vector of \(\gamma_1\)'s LASSO penalty terms. Note that \(\gamma_1 = \frac{2 \lambda_1}{m p (1 - p)}\)

gamma2

A vector of \(\gamma_2\)'s global smoothing parameters. Note that \(\gamma_2 = \frac{4 \lambda_2}{m(m-1)p(p-1)}\)

rho

The \(\rho\) ADMM's penalty parameter

See also
